clear up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to make a place look tidier by putting things back where they belong
clear up.translation[0].definitions[0].e: I don’t mind you using the kitchen as long as you clear up afterwards.
Adam, clear up this mess before your father sees it.
I get really tired of clearing up after you  (=tidying places that you have made untidy).
clear up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to explain or solve something, or make it easier to understand
clear up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The White House hopes these problems can be cleared up soon.
There are a couple of points we need to clear up before the meeting begins.
clear up.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if the weather clears up, it gets better
clear up.translation[0].definitions[3].d: if an illness or infection clears up, it disappears
